channel.title: A little bit of help here please!
channel.description:
Alright guys, I'm trying to make a server here. Let me just start of by saying I'm using Windows 7 Ultimate. So I downloaded No-Ip DUC and made an account and named my server. Under these settings: [img]http://www.freeimagehosting.net/uploads/273d6dc2a3.jpg[/img] And I downloaded ~UniversalScape~ source. This source works great whenever I run the server and go on silabsoft and play without entering a server name. But obviously it doesn't get anymore boring than playing by yourself. I'm making this server to play with friends and stuff. By the way, I have done all the "CLASSPATH" and "PATH" stuff. So now I open the no-ip DUC and then run the server. Whenever I try logging in I get the infamous "Cannot connect to server". I think this is a port forwarding problem. I have a bell modem that is also a router. Whenever I open my CMD and type "ipconfig" it gives me "'ipconfig' is not regognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file". So instead I go to Control Pannel > Network and Internet > Network and Sharing Center > Change adapter settings > Local Area Connection > Details and then copy the IPv4 Default Gateway to my internet browser. I then get this: [img]http://img213.imageshack.us/img213/1817/23188332.jpg[/img]
So I click on "Application Support" and it brings me here:
[img]http://img13.imageshack.us/img13/1906/66034577.jpg[/img]
So I added RsPrivateServer by going to "Enable Application Support" (look in the tabs) and then I get this: [IMG]http://img519.imageshack.us/img519/3952/73796245.jpg[/img]
I have two John-PC, I'm not sure why (witch is the computer I want the server on, and the one I use). The first john-PC is at "maximum protection" setting. And when i click the second john-PC, it's like this: [IMG]http://img229.imageshack.us/img229/9396/25818741.jpg[/img]
Now at this point, I know everyone is confused about what is RsPrivateServer. I clicked on "Add a new user-defined application": [IMG]http://img17.imageshack.us/img17/2981/62131099.jpg[/img] And it brought me to this page: [IMG]http://img7.imageshack.us/img7/3145/44448253.jpg[/img] And I typed the above, and then I assigned it to John-PC. So now I go on silabsoft, but it still gives me the "Error connection to server". So I put it in the second John-PC and still nothing. Am I doing to the right thing? I have been working on this for the past 1-2 hours and still haven't found anything. If someone can help, it would be a big relief.

item.title: A little bit of help here please!
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

deathschaos9:

You log in using localhost as an Ip, not the No-Ip.

My friend is still not able to log in with the no-ip. (It’s servegame.com, btw)

EDIT: I found out why I have two John-PC. It’s because I have to computer named after that. So I renamed this computer to John-Desktop (the second John-PC). I still have the “Error Connection to server though!”

EDIT: I think I fixed my port forwarding problem. If i go to canyouseeme.org and type the port, it is able to see it. However, I still get the “error connecting to server”.

Read full topic
item.source: A little bit of help here please!

item.title: A little bit of help here please!
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

Alright guys, I’m trying to make a server here. Let me just start of by saying I’m using Windows 7 Ultimate.
So I downloaded No-Ip DUC and made an account and named my server. Under these settings:

And I downloaded ~UniversalScape~ source. This source works great whenever I run the server and go on silabsoft and play without entering a server name. But obviously it doesn’t get anymore boring than playing by yourself. I’m making this server to play with friends and stuff.
By the way, I have done all the “CLASSPATH” and “PATH” stuff.
So now I open the no-ip DUC and then run the server. Whenever I try logging in I get the infamous “Cannot connect to server”. I think this is a port forwarding problem. I have a bell modem that is also a router. Whenever I open my CMD and type “ipconfig” it gives me “‘ipconfig’ is not regognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file”. So instead I go to Control Pannel > Network and Internet > Network and Sharing Center > Change adapter settings > Local Area Connection > Details and then copy the IPv4 Default Gateway to my internet browser. I then get this:

So I click on “Application Support” and it brings me here:

So I added RsPrivateServer by going to “Enable Application Support” (look in the tabs) and then I get this:

I have two John-PC, I’m not sure why (witch is the computer I want the server on, and the one I use). The first john-PC is at “maximum protection” setting. And when i click the second john-PC, it’s like this:

Now at this point, I know everyone is confused about what is RsPrivateServer.
I clicked on “Add a new user-defined application”:

And it brought me to this page:

And I typed the above, and then I assigned it to John-PC. So now I go on silabsoft, but it still gives me the “Error connection to server”. So I put it in the second John-PC and still nothing.
Am I doing to the right thing?
I have been working on this for the past 1-2 hours and still haven’t found anything. If someone can help, it would be a big relief.
